title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX)
Interview Descriptions: I had just phone interview with principal investigator. I did power point presentation and It was great experience for me. It was smooth, straightforward but it took almost 2 months.
Interview Questions: What is your experience and qualifications

title: Research Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: If interested, the lab you've applied to should reach out via email and schedule an interview through Zoom. Usually several people will be on the call, these people are going to be your coworkers or supervisors. If they like you enough, you'll be invited to visit the campus in-person to see the lab and talk more about the position.
Interview Questions: Q: How comfortable do you feel working with [research animal]?

title: PhD Candidate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Honestly pretty difficult. All day affair, surprise you with round table interviews that came out of nowhere. It’s why it’s BCM. Very high standards. But worth the effort and an amazing experience.
Interview Questions: Why leave industry for graduate school?

title: Learning And Development Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quick and there was not a prescreening interview. The role was for an IT Administrator, however, I was being interviewed by someone who did not have an IT background. I was not asked any technical questions.
Interview Questions: I was asked if I had experience with a particular software that I did not list on my resume nor my application.

title: Research Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: Met with the lab over zoom and gave a bit of my background. It was very low key and mainly just chatted about expectations of both parties. I wasn’t offered a position mainly because I ended the interview process since the research didn’t align with my needs. It was a good experience nonetheless.
Interview Questions: Are you willing to work with animal models?

title: Business Operations Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: Zoom, panel interview with Chief of Staff, Business Operations Manager, and Department Director of Administration. The lasted approximately 45 minutes. They asked very routine questions, explained the needs of the department, and asked me questions about my interest in the field of higher education in a medical school.
Interview Questions: Did I have any previous experience in higher education in medical schools?

title: Bioinformatics Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Interview with PI and lab manager, followed by 2 more interviews with department head and chair. A PowerPoint presentation for the lab group. All were zoom calls. No in-person interview due to covid.
Interview Questions: How did you address a particularly difficult research problem?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Currently got an interview for 1/17. I applied on 12/19. Interview is via zoom for 1 hour. Will update again tomorrow after Interview. I think the interview is with 4 people total
Interview Questions: Not sure yet will update again soon

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine
Interview Descriptions: it was amazing and so rivetting and so exciting and so slaying in the best way possible. now please stop asking me to fill stuff out that i dont want to fill out.
Interview Questions: my resume was asked okay.

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine
Interview Descriptions: It started with a quick phone screening and scheduling a 30 minute zoom call. After that I then went on to a three hour interview with various members of the team and management.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for BCM?

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone interview with our practice manager. Followed by a full day of one on one interviews with faculty physicians and introductions to the team. After in person interview (pre-COVID), I was offered the position.
Interview Questions: How do you handle a situation where you do not agree with the care of an individual?

title: Healthcare Administrative Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by a panel. I was asked 5 questions and then was given time to ask any questions I had. It was hard to hear some of the interviewers, but when that happened, I just asked them to repeat the question.
Interview Questions: How would you describe yourself in 3 words and why?

title: Research Technician II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was good experience. we Talked mainly about the job offered, previous experiences and careers. it just took about 15 to 20 mins. I Felt comfortable during interview. the interview was conducted via zoom.
Interview Questions: 1.Tell more about yourself 2.Future Goals 3.Previous experience 4. Any visa sponsorship needed 5. If offered, how long would you intend to stay 6. why did u apply for this position

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine
Interview Descriptions: easy  went over resume line by line  experience and lab assays  known lab skill sets, education, special projects, salary expectations, references, starting date, weakness and strengths all discussed in great detail
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself  your salary expectations

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted for an interview through email, and set a date and time for a Zoom meeting. The interviewers were 10 minutes late for the interview. I was informed of the next stage of the interview process and of my point of contact for questions, but the person was unreachable and I never heard whether the position had been filled after the interview.
Interview Questions: Why would you like to work within the pediatric rheumatology research field?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: I had 5 interviews and met 7 different people. I was at the last stage of the hiring process and was sure that I got the offer. I never heard back from them, they just ghosted me.
Interview Questions:
Where do you see yourself in 5 years? 
Why do you want to work in pediatric rheumatology research? 
Do you have any experience in pediatric rheumatology research or data entry?

title: Operations Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine
Interview Descriptions: One Zoom call with the hiring manager, another with the respective team. Overall, it was pretty quick! Few scheduling delays due to the holidays, but nothing major. Every dept. is different, so make sure to ask about the culture!
Interview Questions:
What drew you to the job?
Are you okay working in a team setting?

title: Bioengineering Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: One on one remote interview with doctor. Some simple get-to-know questions, and some questions on previous experience, skills, and projects. Also asks what interests are and which subteam I would like to work on.
Interview Questions: Tell me about this project you worked on.

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine
Interview Descriptions: two to three professors will sit together with you, first, you are asked to give a brief introduction. Then, they will ask some very basic questions about the projects you have listed on your CV. Finally, they will introduce their labs and ask you if you have any questions for them, also when you choose our school.
Interview Questions: Do you have any questions for us?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Meet with the investigator and discussed opportunities.  He then talked about the job and requirements for advancement. I then meet people within the department and discussed the position with them. It was an informal process.
Interview Questions: Q: What are you plans for the future?

title: Assistant Vice President Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Smooth process overall, though lengthy with several sets of panel interviews, which was to be expected given the executive role. About five months from initial job application to job offer.
Interview Questions: What is your strategic vision for the College?

title: Employee Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was over the phone. I was told I’d hear back by the end of the week. After not hearing back I assumed I wasn’t getting the job but reached out to interviewer,  they claimed they were still in the interviewing phase. Here we are about 5 weeks later still nothing.  So I gave you an hour of my time but I don’t even deserve a generic email to let me know I wasn’t chose!? Unprofessional!
Interview Questions: Talk about your experience and background in Employee Relations

title: Senior Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Methodical, organize and comfortable. The interviews with the different professionals was well organize, job experiences related. different scenarios were presented to demonstrate  decision-making skills, Ability to remain calm in stressful situations, Critical thinking skills, Excellent communication skills
Interview Questions: Job related questions for decision making

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: smooth. got a email. scheduled a call interview and then a on site meeting and got the offer. The whole process took only 2 weeks and then the HR process took another week or so.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your research experience?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine
Interview Descriptions: You have to create an account in order to apply. You will get a phone or in person interview call depends on the PI and lab. The interview process was very quick and smooth.
Interview Questions: Would you please introduce yourself?

title: Biomedical Sciences Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was great as the department I joined was very welcoming and insightful. Besides the one on one interviews with faculty members, there was also an opportunity to socialize with the other students as well as the department as a whole during the retreat. It was a pleasant experience.
Interview Questions: What previous research experience do you have?

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine
Interview Descriptions: I first had a get-to-know-you short interview over the phone. A few days later I was scheduled for a zoom interview. It was 1.5 hours long. I interviewed with 6 members of the team. It was the final interview. That same day I was asked for references. The next day my references were contacted. I was told I would hear back regardless. I never did. I tried reaching out for an update. Was just ghosted after that. It was very disappointing and shocking.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: I had a zoom interview that lasted about 30 minutes. I was interviewed by two individuals part of the research team for that specific lab. They asked the typical questions most interviewers ask.
Interview Questions: Describe your Research Experience? Tell me about yourself? What are you strengths and weaknesses?

title: Supply Chain Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Breakdown of job responsibilities  and requirements to complete the job. No d u i amd no moving traffic violations. Overall very easy process pay is not worth it as they pay the minimum possible
Interview Questions: What warehouse experience do you have

title: Research Technician II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine
Interview Descriptions:
First it's an easy over the phone interview. They ask what you have done in the past and they tell you what the job entails.  
Second they invite you to look at the lab and meet the people who work there.
Interview Questions: Are you considering grad school?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine
Interview Descriptions: It was fine. Not too difficult. It really depends on the department as this is a big private company. Some may ask for more technical questions while others may ask for cultural fit.
Interview Questions: An applicant test was provided for IRB applications

title: Communications and Corporate Affairs Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Zoom interview with the hiring manager and other the team member.  Hiring Manager asked all the questions. The other team member was not impressive. that was kind of a big turnoff. They asked for a lot of work examples from my past. Many of which I did not keep. (still waiting to hear back after sending w ork samples)
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself - very broad
Tell me about a biggest mistake you have ever made and how you fessed up to it.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine
Interview Descriptions: The interview process went well. Two interview total and the interviewers were very straight forward and explain what was expected of me very well. Communicated via email and interviewed through zoom which was odd but but doable given we are still dealing with covid.
Interview Questions: What attracted you the position?

title: Medical Writer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Informative and professional. Learned a lot about the job in the interview. They were genuine about wanting to find the right person for the job/make sure it was a good fit.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you would be a fit for this job?

title: PBS Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Great job. Wendy is horrible as management. They don’t care If you’re honest. Penny pushing and all about the money here. Had a wonderful work experience but horrible on the way out. Feel deceived and lied to in the end.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Animal Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Easy and smooth set up. Due to covid it was fine through conference call. You get a pretty good understanding of what to expect from the description during the interview process.
Interview Questions: How did you hear about Baylor college of medicine.

title: HR Business Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview - 30 minutes. Recruiter told me the salary ($50,000 - $61,000) and wanted to know if I was still interested. Due to COV-19 everyone is working from home and I was told the next step would be a panel video conference call.
Interview Questions: Tell me  about yourself

title: Bioinformatics Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: Was given a 30 minute phone interview for bioinformatics position for Baylor college of medicine. Sat in with 3 members of the IT and research team. Did not make it past this phase.
Interview Questions: Asked about previous experience in bioinformatics, pulled questions from aspects of my resume.

title: Data Science Research Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: This was after COVID hit, so it was a virtual interview. Asked me to code something up about transforming a matrix using a kernel. Told me I could use any language, so I did python.
Interview Questions: Matrix Transformation using kernels in python

title: Cell Processing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview was straight forward and quick. The manager seemed to only be trying to fill the position with someone with 100% dedication to the job and no outside life or obligations. Was told they’d inform me about their decision and it’s been 1.5 years and I’m still waiting on their response lol.
Interview Questions: Can you be on call and available all the time?

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Application is online through the Baylor College of Medicine portal. You are contacted by the physician with a phone interview first. Then you meet up in person and chat informally.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Scientist Part Time Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Easy going through very nice. Asked a lot of questions on work experience. Timely interview with single interviewer. Impressed by facilities . Was asked a lot of questions also asked about education and work experience .
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself please.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was easy and straight forward. I was informed about the interview 2 weeks prior to the date, I met with 2 PIs, and 2 other staff. I was briefed about the job duties. They asked about my past experience in research and my long term goals. They were pleasant and courteous. The following week, I was informed to submit 3 references.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your long term goal

title: Buyer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: They emailed you reviewing your application, and asked some introduction screening interview questions before they message you back. If you make it past that then they schedule an interview with you.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for us?

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied online for the Neuroscience program, (international student). Two weeks later, I received an email, which asked me to schedule skype interviews with three professors. Two of them are on my application essay and one is not. The interviews were about one hour.
Interview Questions:
They asked me to talk about my research experience and asked detailed questions about those experiences. like, why do you choose this method, what is the goal of this procedure..
And they asked about why I choose neuroscience

title: Medical Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: Standard med school interview. Info session first followed by 2 interviewers. One can be a current medical student, or both faculty. Pretty standard questions of "Why medicine", etc. Overall interview process is quite similar to that of other medical schools.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose to pursue medicine?

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: The department manager called me about 2 week after I submitted my application to set up an interview for the week after. We had to adjust the time and location a couple times to ensure I could meet everyone on the same day without traveling back and forth. I met with the division director and two of the three attendings in the division.
Interview Questions: What made you interested in this specialty area?

title: Research Coordinator II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Submitted my resume and coverletter online and received an email from my now supervisor a week later to set up an interview. I applied from out of state and funded myself to attend the interview. She honestly didn't realize I was from out of state until I brought it up. The interview was below average. She spent the entire time talking about the center, what they do and what they are looking for. She mentioned a few things she liked on my resume. She offered me the position at the end of the interview.
Interview Questions: How soon would you be able to relocate and start?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine
Interview Descriptions: I met one of the team members in a conference. Things went pretty smooth from there. Phone interview followed by onsite one. However, the HR took a long time to send out the offer letter
Interview Questions: General research work related questions

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone screen; within two days was asked to come in for an interview on Monday. Went in and spoke to 4 different people (two faculty, one senior employee, one current employee). Then had an interview with another higher-up the following Friday. Pretty easy, low-stress environment. Did feel a little rushed though.
Interview Questions: Asked about future career goals

title: HIM Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Took about 3 weeks to call after applying. Had phone interview questions, went great and had to come in for first interview, had to come for a second interviews, then came for a third interview
Interview Questions: Describe yourself

title: Pa Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Really friendly interviewers and students that make you feel so welcome during a very anxious time! The interview styles were casual and the interviewers seem to genuinely want to get to know you.
Interview Questions: Have you ever had to deliver bad news?

title: ACA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very simple and very easy. Most of the questions are your run of the mill interview questions, where others are different. (Such as if one is okay with the humane euthanizing  of animals).
Interview Questions: Are you okay with euthanizing animals?

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was interview by two people. They told me about the position and asked me questions off the top of their heads. Even though the job description says no experience is necessary, they seem to prefer people with experience.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Baylor?

title: Research Technician III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied for the position through their website, and received an email from the lab's PI about a week later detailing the lab's focus and what they were looking for in a candidate. Set up an interview and came in to meet with the PI and tour the lab. It was a very laidback interview and I was only really asked to describe in more detail my duties with my current lab and if I'd performed certain techniques. Received an email later that week with the offer.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience with cell culture?

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Uncomfortable: 2 people conducted the interview. One person SLEPT through the first part of the interview then, focused on his cell phone for all but, the last 5 minutes of the interview. It made me very uncomfortable - I struggled to answer the interview questions. All I could think was why is he sleeping? Then, why is he playing on his cell phone?  The AWAKE person was asking me legitimate questions. I could not focus on the questions because this guy was sleeping and on his cell - HOW CRAZY IS THAT! They are all new to Baylor and looking to update the accounting process.  I was perfect for the job but, I found it hard to concentrate - the guy was SLEEPING!
Interview Questions: How do you prepare a statement of cash flows?

title: ACNP Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine
Interview Descriptions: had 6 different group and 1 to 1 interviews. Somewhat unorganized. All Nps started at st lukes then terminated and had to reapply to same position to work in the same place with the same salary.
Interview Questions: talk about your experience

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was walked into a room with about four individuals (three doctors and on Social Worker) for a specific department within the hospital. It was certainly intimidating; however, they were all using the same interview questions to go through the interview.
Interview Questions: Not applicable, a lot of "if this then what would you do" questions to evaluate transferable skills and then direct questions regarding my experience, goals, etc. They definitely wanted someone who would be happy as a case manager for a while and I was okay not getting the offer since it would have been a starting position to gain experience and in no means long-term. So in that case the interview process worked!

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX)
Interview Descriptions: They essentially asked me if I was willing to X set of things, for Y income. I said "sure". Standard interview questions are employed if you go through HR, more human/organic questions are utilized by individual researchers or practitioners.
Interview Questions: Did you know you would not be doing the job you're being offered if you accept this offer?

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: One phone interview that we discussed about my skills and my goals. One on site interview that discussed with lab members, presented my projects, and talk to PI about my ideas and how can I use my skills on ongoing projects.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine
Interview Descriptions:
contacted by phone
scheduled face to face interview
offered position 6 weeks later
frequent emails from boss with updates

contacted by phone
scheduled face to face interview
offered position 6 weeks later
frequent emails from boss with updates
Interview Questions:
general interview questions
was interviewed by 3 people
offered position through email

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Initial e-mail contact to schedule a phone interview. Phone interview to discuss expectations and understanding of job description and gauge interest. In person all day interview on site with multiple separate interviews with various members of staff.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Very simple and quick. Started off with a basic, tell me about yourself and your career aspirations. Then talked about what skills you have, and what topics I was aware of
Interview Questions: Why BCM?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Typical Postdoctoral interview. Met with the lab group, toured the facilities, interviewed with 5-6 people, had to give an hour long presentation about my graduate dissertation work. I was honestly disgusted by aspects of this interview process because of a lot of unethical conduct. I didn't quite finish my PhD due to severe health issues that are now under control, but the lab PI sought me out and invited me for an onsite review anyway. I was interrogated multiple times about why I didn't finish my dissertation work even though I explained it was due to a medical condition, which I felt was incredibly invasive and unprofessional. One of the PhD's who I interviewed with was disgracefully condescending when asking me about it and point blank said that the fact that I didn't finish my PhD due to health issues was a red flag. That is borderline ILLEGAL conduct. I thought Baylor was a great institution going into the interview, but I couldn't have been more disappointed.
Interview Questions: Why didn't you finish your PhD?

title: Senior Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is very slow moving, until its not. Some departments have you interview two to three times. For the most part, all of the interviews were professional and informative.
Interview Questions: How do I deal with conflict.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Interview was very laid back and easy, however I was told I had to much experience for that lab I applied to, I was told I would get a call back regardless of the decision and I never did. I assumed that I would not get the job simply because I was told my experience was not something she was looking for because she wanted to train the person that would get the job.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job if you are overly qualified?

title: Senior Grants and Contracts Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: I met with the Business Manager of a Baylor dept and he was a poor interviewer.  While we had scheduled an hour from 10-11AM, he was late to our meeting.  Then he had clearly set his cell phone to send a call at exactly 10:55 to which he responded, "our time is up."  Well, if you are late to a scheduled meeting, you owe your "guest" the courtesy of a full hour instead of making her feel like this was just you going through the motions of a psuedo-interview.  But then this interviewer pulls out her compact mirror and reapplies her lipstick while saying she's got a lunch date she needs to leave early for.  WELL, all the preparation and all the nerves of getting ready for a serious meeting seemed wasted.  I felt like a waste.  I had gotten my hopes up .  All for nothing.  The blessing in disguise is that I saw her for her TRUE self before I would make the mistake of working there.  It cost me $10 to park, but saved me $$$$$ in grief and aggravation.  I worry that someone would get into that job without realizing who she is.
Interview Questions: How do you think you can help me?  Asked before he described the details of the job.  Can't read minds.... and hiring manager put no details in the job description!

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Good interview process. I felt confidence but at the same time super nervous. My interview was online and by phone. My interviewer was nice and kind with me. Some questions I felt I dont answer pretty well but other ones yes.
Interview Questions: How I describe my self?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine
Interview Descriptions: The only issue I had was with the Recruiter. It was question after question without any engagement to my responses. No interest in what I had to say. If I was overqualified, why would I be invited into an interview? Waste of my time and the HR Team at BCM.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with a conflict?

title: Programmer Analyst I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed for Programmer Analyst position at HGSC, process involved a phone call and half day at the center where you meet all the developers and the Manager. After that you have a session with the HR.
Interview Questions:
How do you find if two rectangles overlap?
Few questions on database systems and Java programming

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was first contacted by email from someone in the department to set up a phone interview. Due to my fast response the phone interview was conducted the same day. I was then contacted the next day by email to set up an in face interview the following week. Parking was not validating so be sure you're prepared to pay for parking. I interviewed with six people individually within the department and the whole interview process took about 3 hours.
Interview Questions: Tell me where you see yourself in the next few years and how this job is relevant to your goals.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine
Interview Descriptions:
Phone and in office interview.
I first met one of the team members in a conference and knew from that they are hiring. After that went through a series of phone calls (>3) and interview in the office.
Interview Questions: Mainly career oriented

title: Patient Account Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very hectic, almost as if I were a burden. The carpet was dirty and the lights were half burned out. Not the ideal office environment. Everyone looked very tired.
Interview Questions: What do you think we do here?

title: Research Technician III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: After applying online the PI emailed me saying he wanted to interview. I showed up to the interview and after talking for a bit he showed me around the lab. Majority of the interview was me asking questions. After a week he asked for references and then sent his decision the week after.
Interview Questions: What are your long term goals, how long do you want to work?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Ran one hour late. Interviewed or better yet interrogated by a panel of four.  Not one person was welcoming and I could not wait to get out of the room.
Interview Questions: Describe your typical day

title: Research Technician I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: My first interview I met the whole lab team, one by one, it took about 2 hrs in total, they asked many of the same questions in different ways, they were really interested in my future plans, I mentioned grad school which they liked, they asked me about my previous work in other labs, basically they were looking for someone with a passion for science and a long term goal with science, not just a paying job for the bills. I went for a 2nd interview which was about 1hr and a half, we talked about more in detail what the work in the lab was about and he wanted to further gauge my interest and passion. It wasn't a difficult process honestly, but that's because I am congruent to the fact that I really am eager to start working in a lab and to get started on my career, so let your passion show and always think about the job description and about what questions they seem to put emphasis on and tailor a response to their highest priorities.
Interview Questions: What are your future plans?

title: Associate Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone in; face to face. Why do want to work here? What is your weakness and strength? Whats you future goals? where you want to see you in five years from now?
Interview Questions: Tell me about your self? so on.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Just a casual conversation with PI about the lab and your interests. Applied online and was able to get in contact with lab. Not anything to prepare for but depends on lab as well. Try to ask beforehand about what to know.
Interview Questions: What are you looking for in the research you're doing

title: Legal Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: The initial interview was a video conference with a recruiter who liked me and forwarded my resume. a week later she called back and i had an interview scheduled with the College in person. From there i was given a call another few days later that invited me for a second interview. I am still waiting to hear back from the second interview but i feel like it went well.
Interview Questions: What values do you hold that you think reflect on why you should be hired by Baylor

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: My interview was via video and was surprisingly low-key.  I "met" with my future supervisors via Skype.  We first discussed my background - my grad school research and my activities since then.  Then we discussed their research and where I could contribute.
Interview Questions: They asked about my familiarity with FDTD (Fourier domain/time domain) modelling and whether I'd used it.

title: Research Coordinator III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by phone, invited for in-person interview, met with several different people, offer was made not long after. The interview process was very unorganized and I did not meet with everybody I was told I would meet with.
Interview Questions: Can you verbally commit to at least a two year agreement?

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Met with four people, each asking me questions for 30 minutes. They had a matrix that went off and asked me several questions regarding my background. It seemed like they had a hard time asking questions. I was definitely not impressed with Baylor and after a while I started tuning them out. The professors do not have social skills, and one of them even told me he treats the staff like crap. I knew after that moment that I did not want to work for them so I withdrew my application.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Baylor?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: You will interview with a team of 3-4 people. It's pretty much routine. The panel will ask you different questions and you have a chance to ask them questions.
Interview Questions: Have I worked for a manager that I didn't like their management style.

title: Research Technician III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was easy and thorough. I applied online and received an interview call within 15-20 days. The PI of the lab directly contacted me to schedule an interview. After the interview, I was offered the job within the next week. The overall experience of this interview was really good.
Interview Questions: Discuss your previous research experience?

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: I received an email a few weeks after applying asking to schedule an interview. Interview went well, was asked standard questions and ended with a tour of the lab. It was a very relaxed environment and the other employees were very friendly. Got an email about 5 days later saying it was a great interview but they decided to go with another applicant.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Efficient hiring process through Human Resources and on boarding was fairly easy with a streamlined approach. Took one week maximum from start to finish. HR was very communicative throughout and relatively easy to reach through their phone line.
Interview Questions: Past job experiences and references.

title: Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: I did not have a formal interview. I applied and got a walk through and told I received the job. There was an offer directly after the walk through. Easy process.
Interview Questions: Are you available for these times and days.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX)
Interview Descriptions: 1:1 interviews with director, executive director, other members of the team, phone conversations with future colleagues, not a well-organized process centrally as it was all organized within the department
Interview Questions: Previous project management experience

title: Senior Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I had two interviews here.  After the second interview, I was asked for references, which I promptly submitted.  I called all my references and gave them a heads up that they would recieve a call.  None of them were ever contacted.  I gave it some time and contacted the point person at Baylor and I never recieved response.  Very unprofessional and a complete lack of respect for the candidate.  It's not surprising that a Human Resources department was never involved.  Tip to anyway hiring at BCM, the premise of your whole organization should center around being humanistic.  Treat employment candidates with a little more respect and dignity.

Also, to employment candidates: bring extra money for parking, the machines were broken both times I went, and I tried several machines.  It won't accept your money at the first attempt.  I tried so long, that my parking rate went up and I had to pay more than I should have.  Parking is not cheap and they don't validate.
Interview Questions: I honestly didn't care to remember after the experience that I had.

title: Clinical Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward one interview at a time series of three mini interviews thoroughly asked about resume my experience in field likes and dislikes . One on one interview broken up in three sessions
Interview Questions: Tell us about your background

title: Research Tec Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed interview process. Had previous research experience and was recommended to my employer by a former colleague. I met with the hiring manager and we talked more about culture and fit than technical details.
Interview Questions: Are you ok working weekends?

title: Administrative Coordinator III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: You interview with the Administrator and your Future supervisor. They ask questions and review your resume, they ask if you know SAP and what modules. They say that HR will be in touch with you after you have been hired and HR contacts you for the schedule of the orientation.
Interview Questions: Do you know SAP

title: Research Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Got a call first. I was then invited for an in-person interview which lasted around 1hour. I was then interviewed by 2 more people, members of the lab, and then given a short tour of my work area.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, work in group, what are you goals for the next 5 yers

title: Research Technician III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Met with the interviewer. He gave a little talk and showed me around and introduced me to other employees and staff. Then he asked if I had any questions for him. Took around 45 minutes to an hour.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Call Center Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was short, they just asked me if I knew how to answer the phone. Very direct and to the point. Very receptive to questions that you bring to the interview. Dress nice, for sure. No one in the office will be dressed up, but it's good to stand out.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX)
Interview Descriptions: The whole interviewing process took 4 weeks long. I was interview by two different doctors (one was the clinical doctor the other was the non-clinical) . I was given a tour of both laboratories after the last interview. Three days later I was called to see if I would accept the position.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in the next five years?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was given by the principle investigator of the lab through the phone first. then I gave a formal talk at the lab. The job was offered in a week.
Interview Questions: What's your experience

title: Buyer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Extremely organized and prompt! Once I accepted an interview it was added to my calendar in Gmail along with the names of the interviewers. With having the advantage of knowing who I was meeting with and their job title helped me tailor my questions with the interviewers. Overall, it was the best interview process I have ever gone through.
Interview Questions: Explain when you had to deal with a project that had a set back and how did you handle it.

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine
Interview Descriptions: It took an entire morning. It included a tour and an introduction to numerous faculty members. It was a group of three applicants but we interviewed separately with 3-4 different people. I was given adequate information about expectations and allowed plenty of opportunity for questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you would be a good fit here?

title: Student Helper Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I met with the PhD that was doing a lot of the grunt work and got a tour of the lab. Then I had to go and interview with the MD, who mostly explained what the job detailed. Much of it involved me asking him questions than the other way around, and they seemed to want someone who was interested and highly available.
Interview Questions: Can you commit to 20-30 hours a week?

title: Research Coordinator II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview that consisted of several questions about time management and team work. A month later, I was asked to fly down at my own expense to interview. Parking was not paid for and the interview lasted 6 hours with a break for lunch in between.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Postdoctoral Associate/Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Overall, a very well organized and long interview process. Two phone/FactTime interviews with the hiring manager, and then on site interview.  The on site interview was taking care by the department administration, which indicates the PI has more time for research other than chores. They were looking for a scientist and team player. The whole department people, from faculties to administrators are very nice and helpful.
Interview Questions: Questions about my PhD work, skill sets, personality and career goals. Nothing odd or unexpected.

title: Grant Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was asked about my previous experience and the job descriptions on my resume.  Also, which federal and state agencies I've worked with in the past.  The interviewers were straight to the point and were looking for someone who intended to be employed in the position long term.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was short and sweet, leading to a 90 day trial before offering me a full time position. I was interviewed by 2 of the Dr.'s I'd be working for, then introduced to several coworkers, the Chair's office is around the corner so I was quickly familiar with him and the administrator, who I love. I enjoyed the entry process.
Interview Questions: How I felt I could contribute to Baylor.

title: Postdoctoral Associate/Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process for a postdoc is pretty different from any other industry since it's really a match up between the PI and the postdoc with the logistics (i.e., hiring) coming later. BCM made everything unnecessarily difficult. I'm not sure if this was because of the PI (very flighty) or the school (it was like they manufactured red tape), but things were really slow and then they'd give me a deadline of something like 24hrs to get back to them. I think the thing that frustrated me the most was that no one would tell me anything! I didn't even have an offer in writing until I demanded it two weeks before my start date. How can the expect a person to start a job without a full description of salary, benefits, etc?! Ridiculous.
Interview Questions: I didn't have a formal interview, just a meet and greet with the PI, so I wasn't asked any particular questions.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty casual, as is usually the case with Research jobs. I had a brief chat with the Principal Investigator and also chatted with a Postdoc in the lab to get an idea of what they are looking for.
Interview Questions: Previous Experience

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Salt Lake City, UT) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: First i was interviewed by PI then meet with other people of the lab.they intetview. Individually.they show me the y lab talk about my job responsibility..Show their instruments.discuss about the projects
Interview Questions: Ask a lot about previous experience

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: A quick phone interview for about 30 minutes for the first round, and then a half day one-on-one on-site interview with the PI. The whole process is well arranged and very smooth.
Interview Questions: No hard questions

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Got an email from the Hiring manager a few days afterwards and set-up an on-site interview with the team. After a few days got another email to set-up another round with the HR. The same day got another email asking for written references from former employers. Very unusual that references were asked before the offer.
Interview Questions: General background and experience questions. Nothing extra-ordinary.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Came on a one-day visit to interview with hiring manager, his colleagues, and other employees. Went to lunch with would-be co-workers, and dinner with manager. Overall good experience. Gave 1 hour job talk describing my research.
Interview Questions: overall expect challenging questions related to research

title: Research Technician III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was very easy and straight forward. They made me feel very comfortable. I was asked about my past work experience and a few easy technical questions. People interviewing me were very welcoming.
Interview Questions: My past experiences and current availability.

title: Project Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine
Interview Descriptions: I applied online to be a Project Intern in the IT Department, got a response the next day, and interviewed the next week on site. The interview lasted for about half an hour. They asked me very basic behavioral questions, and I think they brought a bank of questions. The interviewers were very kind and despite the standard questions, the interview was quite conversational.
Interview Questions: Honestly, all the questions were fairly standard. Asked about me teamwork experience, how I approach problems, etc.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine
Interview Descriptions: apply online, face-to-face interview. I had the impression that they had a pretty good idea about who to hire from the beginning. So as long as you don't behave like an idiot and be honest with your answers they should give you an offer
Interview Questions: What are you going to do afterwards?

title: Clinical Research Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Met with the upper management - a panel. I had to tell the management, with whom I was in touch, that I coming into town and will be happy to meet them for an interview, after which they set one up.
Interview Questions: I was asked whether I would be able to perform the job I was applying for. What is the first impression people get of me? The whole interview lasted  15-30 minutes.

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Contact me next day, and asked me several questions. Basic question. and Introduced me several ongoing projects and lab environments and then asked me if i had questions and then asked me why chose baylor
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Technician I Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Initial Communication: I received information about this job directly from a contact working for Baylor. She responded to my email within a week. 
Planning: I was invited in for an interview for the following week.
Interview style: There was a lot of open dialogue. It was laid back. Questions were reasonable and related directly to the position. It was not a business HR "what is your greatest weakness" type of interview.
Interview Questions: Since my experience came from working in a lab as a volunteer, I was asked why my previous lab didn't hire me.

title: Linux Systems Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: I first met with the people I would be working directly with. It was great conversation and after a brief discussion of my background we went to a conference room to meet with other people in the department. There was plenty of light in the room and the chairs were semi-comfortable. They were very friendly except for one person. Overall, a lot of good questions were asked and the interview felt "business casual". Then I met with the director for a bit and talked a little bit more about my background and what my expectations were. She was very friendly and I was energized by the discussion.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have with HIPAA and working with highly sensitive information?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions:
It was not a quick interview. Very vague on what they wanted and salary questions.
It was not a hard interview.  They look for personalities that will mesh with their team.
Interview Questions: How much money i wanted

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine
Interview Descriptions: I had one phone interview and the hiring person asked me some questions, explained their projects and works, and mentioned what he/she expected me to do
Interview Questions: It was a routine interview and I didn't find it difficult at all

title: Research Technician III Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Whole department (3) people interviewed me! Program heads and supervisor. Lab manager sometimes does the interview too. I had to go twice for the interview! two rounds could be held. Sometimes they can do the phone call interview too but mine was face to face as I was in the same place.
Interview Questions: QPCR overview

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview in March 2014. Asked me about my background and studies. Talk about what I was going to do. And asked some questions about sas and bio stuff. I have no background on bio.
Interview Questions: are you good at using sas?

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: I present my graduate work in the during their lab meeting time. I got chance to meed some people during the lunch and in the afternoon. Finally talked to the PI.
Interview Questions: They ask about my research.

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Number of interview: 1. Came in, interviewed with lab PI, and was asked general questions. Was asked my background experience and if I have expertise in the lab techniques.
Interview Questions: No difficult question. All straight forward.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine
Interview Descriptions: This process is specific to each PI
Interview Questions: I was only asked questions based on my scientific background

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine
Interview Descriptions: They don't give opportunities to grow in my career
Interview Questions: I had to pass a test in the interview

title: Research Coordinator II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: I had a 1:1 interview with the person who would become my direct manager. It involved about 1 hour of questions, a tour of the department, and introduction to some team members. Once I had the interview, I was asked for my references which were all checked and then offered the job about 1 week later.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my experience working on multiple studies at once and what my communication strategies are for keeping very busy clinicians on track.

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Typical asking about myself, what's my goal are, what are your future plans, do you know how to do so-so things that the job posted was about.  I was honest, I didn't know anything about those equipments, but I knew some concept of what it was use for and described what I know.  I also said I would love the opportunity to learn about it.
Interview Questions: You ever resolved any problems?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Based on advertisement in different job sites or personal advertisement after a talk by professor one can apply for the position. Employer will contact immediately and ask for recommendation letters. If satisfied employer will contact applicant for telephone interview and/or site interview. If satisfied employer will offer formally then administrative person will be in touch paper work.
Interview Questions: No such difficult question for me

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied in late December.  I received an email in early January for an interview weekend in February.  The program paid for the flights, and hotel.  I shared a hotel room with another interviewee.  The interview was at the school on a Friday.  There were about 16 of us.  There was breakfast and a short overview in the morning before the interview.  I interviewed with six faculty, one of whom was the program director.  Lunch was provided, and there was a brief campus tour.  That evening we had a Tex-Mex dinner party.
Interview Questions:
Explain your Research?
Why do you want a phd?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: All the people that interviewed me made me feel very comfortable. They were nice enough to show me around the labs, meet various other colleagues and went  in to great detail (going through a power point presentation for me).
Interview Questions: What I have been studying at University

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Long list of people one after another.  Tiring to say the least and that was day one.  Then had to come back and meet the the CEO and CFO 1:1 as well on day two.  Even more tiring that the first day, but it was worth it because I go the job.  I wasn't given the option below, but the interview actually took place in 2012 and I received a major promotion since then, so my job title changed quite a bit.
Interview Questions: Depended on the person, but mostly, why do you want the job.

title: Senior Applications Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: There was no phone screen of any type. Arranged for 2 hours of face to face interview. There were three groups of interviewers. (1) With Development Team. This consisted of being interviewed with 5 people ina conference table setting. Also included PMs for the various projects. (2) With management/Director of the Group and (3) WIth the Operations ( or SA and DBA team) All the people were very friendly and Very professional in their actions, questions and suggestions. Very friendly folks. Very knowledgeable
Interview Questions:
Why choose Baylor above say MD Anderson?
Why want to move from current role?
Various development(J2EE/Java)  related questions

title: Senior Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was initially contacted by the project manager for an informal phone interview where we discussed my previous exposure to linux system administration, familiarity with JBoss/Tomcat environments and technical skills relating to managing VMs using VmWare. Then, I was informed they wanted to me to come meet the team in their department, which consisted of mini-interviews with another system administrator, the head of the department and a group of programmers. Overall, i was impressed with the atmosphere and enjoyed meeting with this group in an academic research environment.
Interview Questions: This involved steps you would take to troubleshoot a virtual machine which was randomly crashing at odd intervals.

title: Histology Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: Only one interview.  I was given a tour of the facility.  I was asked to give three words that describe me.  Two weeks later I was hired.
Interview Questions: Why don't I speak Spanish?

title: Animal Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: I had my first interview offsite which was one on one, that interview went well so I was asked to do a second interview which is where I was interviewed by four managers at one time.
Interview Questions: how did I feel about euthanizing an animal if I was told to do so.

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: i met with two people the first time and they asked the various questions of my background and where did i work before. I then was able to come back and asked other questions when the doctors were there to answer their questions. I had a great time speaking with them
Interview Questions: did i find location ok

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the office's Senior Director and the department's Vice President. Most employees that get hired in administrative positions, myself included, are referred by other employees. They mostly explained to me what their department does, and I confirmed and explained that I could indeed perform the job duties outlined.
Interview Questions: How will your work forward the mission of Baylor College of Medicine?

title: UI Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: two panel interviews - first interview with dev team - second interview with Director/VP and dev team
Interview Questions: Q. Describe a decision you made that was unpopular and how you handled implementing it.

title: CRA II Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview was pretty easy, just asked me typical questions, like what are you looking for? tell me a little about yourself, your experience,etc.

The F2F interview was hard! they asked me a lot of questions about GHP guidelines, whats the most important document in my opinion, list any hard experiences ive had and how i solved them, how to prepare for a MV, COV, a PI meeting, etc.
Interview Questions: what is the most important ghp document in your opinion?

title: Staff Non Invasive Cardiology Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Standard interview. Submitted my CV to their office. They offered me a interview and paid for travel. Met with several people throughout the day. Got a good idea of the facilities and what the daily schedule would be. Fairly relaxed process. Nothing to put you on the spot. These interviews are mainly looking to weed out  people who would not be a good fit or they feel have a personality that may be problematic.
Interview Questions: Usual things. They did ask to do a presentation for follow up interview.i

title: Post Doc Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Paid for flight out to Texas for a presentation and meetings with the department staff. I arrived in Houston and was put into a shuttle for transportation to my hotel where I was supposed to meet for dinner. Traffic was so bad I was late but they still picked me up for dinner as I was starving and they took me to Indian food. A student from the lab picked me up from my hotel in the morning of the interview. Met with all 4 of the pharmacology departmental faculty for about 30 min each. I was interviewing with the chair of the department for a position in his lab on Antimicrobial Resistance. It felt more like recruitment and seeing if I would be a good fit or bring skills than an interview.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?

title: Research Technician II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Nov 2010
Interview Descriptions: Very courteous atmosphere, my interview consisted with directors of all the major labs and a showcase of what some of the labs did. On my final interview date I was shown the lab I would be working in and met the people in that lab.All in all it was a very professional atmosphere.
Interview Questions: What is your strongest and weakest point?

title: Research Coordinator III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process went very well. It started with a telephone interview followed up with a in person interview. Everything went smoothly and very quickly. The interview mainly went over my research coordinator experience and my willingness to learn other areas of research.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: 2 times of interviews
Interview Questions: Please explain your graduate project

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: This depends on each department in BCM. A typical case entails a one day interview with around 5 to 7 principal investigators and second day familiarizing with the city and school with the current students.
Interview Questions: All day interview was slightly tiring.

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Saint Louis, MO) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: Basic stuff.  phone interview and in person.  Just stay confident and dress appropriately.  3 interviews about 30 min each.  Short process took about a half a day.  Got the job offer the next week, wasn't able to negegiate an increase in salary. very effcient process.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Clinical Information Systems Analyst II Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Dec 2009
Interview Descriptions: A former co-worker mentioned that they had an opening and suggested that I contact her manager. I spoke to the manager on the telephone, then had a group interview a few weeks later. The group was all female and for the most part, very welcoming. The questions were fairly standard. I didn't hear from them for at least 6 weeks before they called to offer me the position.
Interview Questions: Do you consider yourself a database person, a programmer or a Web developer?

title: Accountant II Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Baylor College of Medicine (Houston, TX) in Nov 2009
Interview Descriptions: There interviewing process sucks, it's very simple and they have no plan nor strategy set up kind of like the work flow of the company. They asked a couple of questions and tell you what's expected of you.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your last job?
